data.title: Carmelo Anthony Biography
data.meta_description: Read all about Carmelo Anthony with TV Guide's exclusive biography including their list of awards, celeb facts and more at TV Guide.
data.text:
Fast Facts

Was a McDonald's and Parade Magazine All-American in high school

In 2003, led Syracuse to its first national basketball championship in his only season at the school; was named NCAA tournament MVP

Was the third pick in the 2003 NBA Draft by the Denver Nuggets

Played for the U

S

Olympic basketball team, winnning a bronze medal in 2004 and gold in 2008, 2012 and 2016; after the 2016 Olympics in Rio, he announced he was retiring from the U

S

national team

Has done charity work for children's organizations, tsunami relief and Hurricane Katrina victims

Donated $3 million to Syracuse University for new practice facilities, which the university named the Carmelo K

Anthony Center

Founded a production company, Krossover Entertainment

Married entertainer La La Vazquez in 2010; the ceremony was filmed for the reality series La La's Full Court Wedding

In 2011, traded from the Denver Nuggets to his hometown New York Knicks, who play at Madison Square Garden, the arena where he scored his first collegiate basket

Set a New York Knicks and Madison Square Garden record for points in a game with 62 points on Jan

24, 2014
